TITLE: Tying the knot this year? Add ‘marriage tax penalty’ to the potential cost
SUMMARY: While a so-called marriage tax penalty is less likely to happen these days, some newlyweds still pay more to Uncle Sam as a couple than when they were single.

TITLE: Want to buy more than $10,000 in nearly risk-free I bonds? Here are a few strategies
SUMMARY: There are a few strategies for putting away more than the technical $10,000 limit annually in federal I bonds, which currently pay a record 9.62% annual rate.

TITLE: Here’s why inflation may be less costly for some retirees
SUMMARY: Annual inflation grew by 8.3% in April, but some retirees may be shielded from certain swelling costs, according to a J.P. Morgan report.

TITLE: IRS insists destruction of 30 million files of taxpayer data won't affect payers
SUMMARY: Filers won't be affected by the IRS decision to destroy 30 million so-called paper information returns, the agency said.

TITLE: How to calculate your own personal inflation rate amid rising prices
SUMMARY: To figure out how much inflation is impacting your wallet depends on what you're spending and where. Here's how to calculate your personal inflation rate.

TITLE: Buy now, pay later is not a boom, it’s a bubble, Harvard researcher says
SUMMARY: Since the start of the coronavirus pandemic, installment payments have exploded in popularity along with a general surge in online shopping.

TITLE: Here are some strategies to pay off credit card debt before interest rates rise again
SUMMARY: "The biggest key to get out of credit card debt is to not be paying a high interest rate on that debt," said personal finance expert Suze Orman.

TITLE: Negotiating a job offer works: 85% of Americans who counteroffered were successful. Here's how to do it
SUMMARY: Most Americans accepted the initial offer at their current job without negotiating, but those who did negotiate often walked away with more, a survey found.

TITLE: Ahead of hurricane season and summer storms, be sure you know how weather events are covered by your homeowners insurance
SUMMARY: Regardless of where you live, it's important to know which types of weather-related damage your homeowners insurance covers.

TITLE: Tax professionals ‘horrified’ by IRS decision to destroy data on 30 million filers
SUMMARY: The IRS destroyed an estimated 30 million so-called paper-filed information returns in March 2021, sparking anger from the tax community.

TITLE: House passes bill aimed at curbing the $2.9 billion seniors lose each year to financial scams
SUMMARY: Unsuspecting older Americans get duped by financial scams every year. Now, a bill in Congress aims to increase regulators' abilities to help stop that.

TITLE: Inflation is costing U.S. households an extra $341 a month. Here's what's more expensive and how you can save some money
SUMMARY: Consumer prices rose 8.3% in March, according to the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics.

TITLE: Op-ed:  That college degree is no longer the only path to achieving the American Dream
SUMMARY: As employers recognize that the lack of a four-year college degree doesn't mean a potential worker doesn't have value, the return on investment for university graduates is dropping.

TITLE: Retiring soon with a pension? Here's how rising interest rates can affect your lump-sum benefits
SUMMARY: As interest rates continue to climb, it's worth considering how that may impact getting your  benefits as a lump sum instead of an annuity.

TITLE: Bitcoin is coming to 401(k) plans. But not your target-date fund
SUMMARY: Fidelity Investments is letting employers offer a bitcoin investment in 401(k) plans. But TDFs, the most popular retirement funds, aren't yet taking the plunge.

TITLE: High inflation continues to point to bigger Social Security cost-of-living adjustment in 2023
SUMMARY: If record high inflation continues, Social Security beneficiaries may see a bigger increase to their monthly checks next year. Here's what to watch.

TITLE: How fast does inflation cut buying power? Here's a simple guide
SUMMARY: Rising prices for goods and services mean your money buys less. The "rule of 72" can help gauge how quickly its value decreases.

TITLE: Nearly 7 in 10 Americans want to live to 100, study finds. Here’s how retirement is changing
SUMMARY: Despite fears of outliving savings, most Americans still want to live longer, with 65% hoping to reach age 100, according to a study on longevity.

TITLE: Inflation remained near a 40-year high in April. Here's where consumers plan to cut spending
SUMMARY: Inflation is still near a 40-year high, prompting consumers to cut spending, according to a CNBC + Acorns Invest in You survey.

TITLE: Two-thirds of Americans live paycheck to paycheck as inflation continues to climb
SUMMARY: More Americans are feeling financially strained, as prices for basic necessities keep climbing.

TITLE: Medical debt has dropped during pandemic, new research shows. That trend soon could shift
SUMMARY: Pandemic-era programs that have helped Americans secure health insurance are scheduled to end in the coming months, which could lead to more medical debt.

TITLE: 'Women lost a lot of ground in the pandemic,' says Ellevest CEO Sallie Krawcheck. But they can take steps to start recovering financially
SUMMARY: While women face financial hurdles, there are steps they can take to build wealth, says Ellevest CEO Sallie Krawcheck. And the men in their lives can help, too.

TITLE: Here's one way Social Security could better address life expectancy for couples
SUMMARY: A spouse's death can cause a devastating loss of income for their partner. Social Security benefits may be adjusted to help pare those losses, research finds.

TITLE: 43% of investors say they're too nervous to get into markets right now. Here's why they should invest anyway
SUMMARY: Some 43% of investors they're too nervous to invest in the market right now, according to an online survey of more than 1,000 adults conducted in March.

TITLE: Here’s why a Roth individual retirement account conversion may pay off in a down market
SUMMARY: Roth individual retirement account conversions may be cheaper during a stock market downturn. Here's what to consider before making the transfer.

TITLE: Consumer credit card debt and annual percentage rates are heading to an all-time high
SUMMARY: Higher prices are causing Americans to increasingly lean on their credit cards. As the Fed raises interest rates, it will get more expensive to carry a balance.

TITLE: Employers requiring job applicants to have a Covid-19 vaccine is declining, study finds
SUMMARY: The share of employers requiring job applicants to have a Covid-19 vaccine is falling, likely because fewer of them see it as a competitive edge.

TITLE: The Great Resignation has changed the workplace for good. ‘We’re not going back,’ says the expert who coined the term
SUMMARY: Many employers now offer flexibility and wellness benefits to attract and retain talent. "The new changes are here to stay," says psychologist Anthony Klotz.

TITLE: Why there's a unified movement to cancel student loans but not credit card debt or mortgages
SUMMARY: There are some meaningful reasons that explain why there's been such a strong, unified and widening movement to get education debt, in particular, wiped out.

TITLE: This strategy may help ensure you won't run out of money in retirement
SUMMARY: If you want to make sure your retirement savings lasts through your golden years, one possible strategy involves required minimum distributions.
